title: How to Mass Delete Emails from the Same Sender

steps.title: Login to your Gmail account.
steps.content: Login to your Gmail account. To do so, open a web browser. Navigate to https://mail.google.com , and log in to your Gmail account . You can use any web browser on a PC or Mac.

steps.title: Type "from:[email address]" in the search field and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type "from: [email address]" in the search field and press ↵ Enter . The search field is above the inbox or list of emails. After you press "Enter," you'll see a list of emails sent from that address.

steps.title: Click the checkbox to select all emails.
steps.content: Click the checkbox to select all emails. It's in the upper-left corner above the checkboxes next to each email in the search results list. This will select the first 50 emails in your list. You can also click the downwards-facing arrow to edit your selection.

steps.title: Click Select all conversations that match this search.
steps.content: Click Select all conversations that match this search . If there are more than 50 emails, you will see a blue link that says "Select all conversations that match this search" appear above the list of emails. Click this link to select the rest of the emails in the search results. You may need to confirm this action by clicking OK in the pop-up box when prompted.

steps.title: Click the trashcan icon.
steps.content: Click the trashcan icon. It's in the menu bar at the top of the page on the left side. This will move all selected emails to your trash. All emails in the trash folder will be permanently deleted 30 days after they were moved into the trash

steps.title: Open your Trash folder.
steps.content: Open your Trash folder. To do so, click Trash in the menu bar to the left. If you don't see "Trash" in the menu bar to the left, click More to expand the menu.

steps.title: Click Empty Trash now.
steps.content: Click Empty Trash now . It's above the list of emails in your Trash folder. This will permanently delete all emails in your Trash folder. [1] X Research source It is recommended you review the Trash folder before permanently deleting everything. If you see any emails you want to keep, click the checkbox next to it, click the folder with an arrow pointing right, and then select the folder (i.e., "Inbox") you want to move it to.

steps.title: Open Gmail.
steps.content: Open Gmail. It has an icon that resembles a red, green, yellow, and blue "M." You can find this app on your home screen, in the app drawer, or by searching. You can use this method on any mobile device that uses Gmail, and the steps are the same. Most of the time, Android phones and tablets use Gmail as their default email app. If you don't have the Gmail application, you can download it from the Google Play Store on Android or the App Store on iPhone and iPad.

steps.title: Type "from:[email address]" in the search field and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type "from: [email address]" in the search field and press ↵ Enter . The search field is at the top of the inbox or list of emails. After you press "Enter," you'll see a list of emails sent from that address.

steps.title: Tap the icon next to the message to select it.
steps.content: Tap the icon next to the message to select it. This will display a checkbox next to the email and a checkbox next to the rest of the emails.

steps.title: Tap Select all.
steps.content: Tap Select all . It's at the top of the page. This selects all emails on the page. Unfortunately, there isn't a way to select all emails from a sender using the Gmail app. You may need to delete several pages worth of emails separately to get all of them.

steps.title: Tap the trashcan icon.
steps.content: Tap the trashcan icon. It's at the top of the page. This will move all emails to the trash folder. . [2] X Research source All emails in the trash folder will be permanently deleted 30 days after they were moved into the trash

steps.title: Open the Trash folder.
steps.content: Open the Trash folder. To do so, tap the icon with three lines ( ☰ ) in the upper-left corner to open the menu. Then tap Trash in the menu.

steps.title: Tap Empty Trash Now.
steps.content: Tap Empty Trash Now . This will permanently delete all emails in the Trash folder. It is recommended you review the trash folder before permanently deleting everything. If you see emails you want to keep, tap the icon next to the email to select it, tap the icon with three dots ( ⋮ ) in the upper-right corner, select Move to , then tap the folder you want to move the emails to.

steps.title: Log in to your Outlook account.
steps.content: Log in to your Outlook account. To do so, go to https://outlook.live.com/ in a web browser and log in to your Microsoft account. You can use any web browser on a PC or Mac.

steps.title: Type "from:[email address]" in the search field and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type "from: [email address]" in the search field and press ↵ Enter . The search bar is at the top of the page. This displays all emails from the email address you searched.

steps.title: Click the checkbox next to "All."
steps.content: Click the checkbox next to "All." It's at the top of the page on the left side. It's above the checkboxes next to all the emails. This checks all emails in your list.

steps.title: Click Delete all.
steps.content: Click Delete all . It's in the center of the page next to an icon that resembles a trashcan. This will move as many as 75 emails to your Deleted folder. If there are more than 75 emails, you may need to search and select another 75 emails and delete them.

steps.title: Open the Deleted folder.
steps.content: Open the Deleted folder. To do so, click Deleted items in the menu bar to the left.

steps.title: Click Empty folder.
steps.content: Click Empty folder . It's at the top of the page. This will display a prompt asking if you want to delete all items in the Deleted folder. It is recommended you review the trash folder before permanently deleting everything. If you see any emails you want to keep, click the checkbox next to it and then click Restore in the menu bar at the top of the page.

steps.title: Click Delete all.
steps.content: Click Delete all . This deletes all items in the Deleted folder.

steps.title: Open Outlook.
steps.content: Open Outlook. This app icon looks like a blue sheet and envelope with an "O" next to it. You'll find this on either your home screen, in the app drawer, or by searching. You can use this method on any mobile device that Outlook uses (including Android and iOS), and the steps are similar. The mobile app, however, does not support the functionality to select multiple messages at a time, so you will have to open each email and delete it manually.

steps.title: Tap the search icon .
steps.content: Tap the search icon . It's the icon that resembles a magnifying glass in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: Type the sender's email address.
steps.content: Type the sender's email address. Make sure you press "Enter" on your keyboard when you're done. All the emails from that sender will appear.

steps.title: Tap an email to open it.
steps.content: Tap an email to open it. Unfortunately, the mobile app does not have a way to select multiple emails, so you will have to open every email. If there are a lot of emails, it's recommended you use the web application on a computer.

steps.title: Tap the trashcan icon.
steps.content: Tap the trashcan icon. It's at the top of the page. This will move the email to the "Deleted" folder.

steps.title: Repeat the previous 2 steps until all the messages are deleted.
steps.content: Repeat the previous 2 steps until all the messages are deleted. While you are going through each email one by one, check each one to make sure you really want to delete it.

steps.title: Open the Deleted folder.
steps.content: Open the Deleted folder. To do so, tap your profile icon in the upper-left corner. Then tap Deleted in the menu.

steps.title: Tap the trashcan icon at the top.
steps.content: Tap the trashcan icon at the top. This will display a prompt asking if you want to permanently delete the email. It is recommended you review the trash folder before permanently deleting everything. If you see any emails you want to keep, tap the icon next to the email to select it. Then tap the icon that resembles a folder with an arrow in the upper-right corner. Tap the folder (i.e., "Inbox") to which you want to move the email.

steps.title: Tap Permanately delete.
steps.content: Tap Permanately delete . It's the red text in the prompt. This will permanently delete all emails in your Deleted folder.

steps.title: Open Mail.
steps.content: Open Mail. This app icon looks like a white envelope on a blue background. You can find this on your dock or your home screen. The Apple Mail app is the default for iOS and macOS devices and pulls emails from linked accounts, such as Gmail and Yahoo.

steps.title: Type the sender you want to find all the emails from.
steps.content: Type the sender you want to find all the emails from. The search bar is at the top of the mail app, but if you don't see it, swipe down to reveal it. Don't forget to tap the search icon on your keyboard. When you do press the search icon, every email from that sender is listed.

steps.title: Tap Edit.
steps.content: Tap Edit . You'll see this in the bottom right corner of your screen. You'll see the options for Move , Archive , Mark , and/or Delete appear.

steps.title: Tap the circle icon next to all the emails you want to delete.
steps.content: Tap the circle icon next to all the emails you want to delete. This will place a checkmark next to each email and highlight them in blue. There is no option to select all emails, but you can tap the circle next to the email at the top and drag down to select multiple emails at one time.

steps.title: Tap the trashcan icon.
steps.content: Tap the trashcan icon. It's at the bottom of the page. This moves all the selected emails to the Trash folder.

steps.title: Open the Trash folder.
steps.content: Open the Trash folder. To do so, tap Mailboxes at the top of the page in the upper-left corner. Then tap Trash .

steps.title: Select all emails in the Trash folder.
steps.content: Select all emails in the Trash folder. To do so, tap Edit in the upper-right corner and then tap Select All in the upper-left corner.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . It's in the bottom-right corner. This will permanently delete all emails in the Trash folder. It is recommended you review the trash folder before permanently deleting everything. If you see any emails you want to keep, tap the icon next to the email to select it. Tap Move at the bottom of the screen. Then tap the folder (i.e., "Inbox") that you want to move the email to.

steps.title: Open the Mail app.
steps.content: Open the Mail app. You'll find this in the Dock or Applications folder. It has a blue icon with a white folder.

steps.title: Type the email address into the search bar and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type the email address into the search bar and press ↵ Enter . You'll find the search bar above your inbox.

steps.title: Click an email in the search results.
steps.content: Click an email in the search results. You'll see the body of the message on the right side of the window.

steps.title: Press ⌘ Cmd+A.
steps.content: Press ⌘ Cmd + A . All the emails will be selected.

steps.title: Click the trashcan icon.
steps.content: Click the trashcan icon. You'll see this button above your list of search results, next to a thumbs-down icon. All your selected messages will be deleted. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Login to your Yahoo account.
steps.content: Login to your Yahoo account. To do so, go to https://login.yahoo.com/ in a web browser and log in to your Yahoo account. You can use any web browser on a PC or Mac.

steps.title: Type "from:[email address]" in the search field and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type "from: [email address]" in the search field and press ↵ Enter . You'll see the search field above the inbox or list of emails. After you press "Enter," you'll see a list of emails sent from that address.

steps.title: Click the checkbox above the search results.
steps.content: Click the checkbox above the search results. It's above the checkboxes next to each email. This will select all emails in the search results. You can click the downwards-facing arrow to edit your selection.

steps.title: Click Delete.
steps.content: Click Delete . It's in the menu bar at the top of the page. It's next to an icon that resembles a trashcan. This moves all emails to your Trash folder. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Trash folder.
steps.content: Open the Trash folder. To do so, click Trash in the menu bar to the left. If you don't see the Trash folder, click More in the menu bar to the left to expand the menu.

steps.title: Select all emails in the trash folder.
steps.content: Select all emails in the trash folder. To do so, click the checkbox above all the emails in the trash folder.

steps.title: Click Delete followed by Ok.
steps.content: Click Delete followed by Ok . It's at the top of the page. This permanently deletes all emails in the trash folder. It is recommended you review the trash folder before permanently deleting everything. If you see any emails you want to keep, tap the icon next to the email to select it. If you see an email you want to keep, click the checkbox next to the email, then click Restore to Inbox at the top of the page.

steps.title: Open the Yahoo Mail app.
steps.content: Open the Yahoo Mail app. The Yahoo Mail app has a purple icon with a white envelope. Tap the Yahoo Mail app icon on your Home screen or Apps menu to open it.

steps.title: Tap the magnifying glass icon .
steps.content: Tap the magnifying glass icon . It's in the upper-right corner. This displays the search bar.

steps.title: Type "from:[email address]" in the search field.
steps.content: Type "from: [email address]" in the search field. The search field is at the top of the page. This displays all emails from that email address.

steps.title: Select all emails from the sender.
steps.content: Select all emails from the sender. To do so, tap the icon next to one email to select it. Then tap Select all at the top of the page

steps.title: Tap the trashcan icon.
steps.content: Tap the trashcan icon. It's the first tab at the bottom of the page. This moves the emails to the Trash folder.

steps.title: Open the Trash folder.
steps.content: Open the Trash folder. To do so, tap Inbox at the bottom of the page. Then tap Trash in the folder.

steps.title: Select all emails in the trash folder.
steps.content: Select all emails in the trash folder. To do so, tap the icon next to one email to select it. Then tap Select all at the top of the page.

steps.title: Tap the trashcan icon and then tap Ok.
steps.content: Tap the trashcan icon and then tap Ok . The trashcan icon is in the lower-right corner. This permanently deletes all selected emails. It is recommended you review the trash folder before permanently deleting everything. If you see any emails you want to keep, tap the icon next to the email to select it. Tap the icon that resembles a folder with an arrow pointing up at the bottom, then tap the folder (i.e., "Inbox") you want to move the email to.
